tasks.task: Utilize and maintain a tractor for farming operations
subtasks: Operate the tractor to drive the implement
Align the implement with the rows for mulching
Adjust the depth at which the implement cuts the soil
Monitor the tractor's performance and make necessary adjustments
Refuel the tractor as needed during work hours
Check the implement's attachment and detachment mechanism
Clean and service the implement after use
Lubricate moving parts of the implement

tasks.task: Prepare and apply mulch using an implement attached to the tractor
subtasks: Load mulch onto the implement
Distribute mulch evenly on the field
Cover the plants or soil surface to retain moisture
Avoid overmulching which can smother plants
Adjust the spreader or distributor settings as necessary
Check for clogs or blockages in the implement

tasks.task: Manage time and schedule agricultural field operations
subtasks: Plan the start time based on weather forecasts
Estimate the duration needed to complete mulching the field
Account for breaks and rest periods during long workdays
Adjust schedule if unexpected mechanical issues arise
Plan the sequence of fields to minimize travel time

tasks.task: Ensure proper attachment of equipment to the tractor
subtasks: Check the hitch or drawbar connection
Tighten any bolts or fasteners before operation
Verify the safety chains or pins are in place
Test the implement's ability to turn freely

tasks.task: Adjust tractor wheels for optimal soil coverage
subtasks: Check wheel alignment and make adjustments if necessary
Check tire pressure and inflate if necessary
Clean the tires to remove debris that could damage the tires
Apply agricultural tires with the correct specifications for the workload

tasks.task: Inspect and maintain the tractor's hydraulic system
subtasks: Check hydraulic fluid levels
Check for leaks in hoses and connections
Lubricate hydraulic pivot points
Replace hydraulic filters as per the manufacturer's recommendation

tasks.task: Apply security measures during tractor operation
subtasks: Signal other farm workers to stay clear of the operating area
Use personal protective equipment (PPE) such as gloves and safety glasses
Position the tractor to avoid potential roll-over hazards
Secure any loose parts on the tractor that could become entangled

tasks.task: Handle potential mechanical issues with the tractor
subtasks: Troubleshoot a slipping implement attachment
Address a noisy or vibrating implement
Check for excessive oil or fluid leaks
Replace a broken or detached hose
Check the implement's control mechanisms for malfunction

tasks.task: Adapt to changing weather conditions while operating the tractor
subtasks: Adjust the working speed of the tractor in wet soil
Modify the depth setting for different soil types
Choose appropriate mulch material based on weather conditions (e.g., light mulch in windy conditions)
